Name: Session3_short
Title: Week 3: Part 1
Description: Welcome! The domains listed here are some areas that may cause teens to feel anxious. Please select the one that you'd like to work on during today's training.

BeforeDomain.Name: Welcome Back!
BeforeDomain.Title: Welcome Back!
Description: Welcome back to MindTrails! Let's get started with practicing flexible thinking. Today, you will: answer a few questions about your anxiety, practice 15 brief flexible thinking scenarios, and wrap-up with an exercise using your own anxiety-provoking situation Let's get started!

BeforeDomain.Name: Three Brief Questions
BeforeDomain.Title: Three Brief Questions
Description: Thinking about the last 24 hours, how anxious have you felt? 0 = Most calm I could imagine being. 10 = Most anxious, panicked, or scared I could imagine being.

BeforeDomain.Name: Three Brief Questions
BeforeDomain.Title: Three Brief Questions
Description: Thinking about the last 24 hours, how much were you able to change the way you thought about things when you wanted to feel better. (An example might be: If you were feeling worried about an upcoming test, were you able to think about how much you studied, so that you felt less worried?) 0 = Not at all -- I wasn't able to think in different ways to feel better. 10 = Completely-- I was totally able to think in different ways to feel better.

BeforeDomain.Name: Three Brief Questions
BeforeDomain.Title: Three Brief Questions
Description: Thinking about the last 24 hours, how much did you try to stay away from or be less involved in situations that would make you anxious or scared? (An example might be: If your teacher asked a question to the class and you knew the answer, do you not answer so you won't draw attention to yourself?) 0 = I tried to stay away from doing anything and everything that would make me anxious or scared. 10 = If there was something that would make me anxious or scared.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: In this exercise, please think of an UPCOMING situation that you expect will make you feel anxious, worried, or scared. Pick a situation that you worry might go badly, or that you expect will bring on feelings of anxiety (like racing heart, sweating). Any situation that will make you feel quite anxious or scared will work, as long as it is a situation that is likely to actually happen.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: Please describe the situation in a few words:

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: Please imagine the situation as vividly as possible (i.e., so that it feels very real). Try to imagine you are actually in the situation. Play out the specific parts of the situation in your head. Try to imagine using all your senses while you think about this situation. Think about the things you would see, hear, and smell if you were really in that situation. Think about the kinds of things you would think or feel if you were actually there.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: Play this situation in your head for the next 20 seconds.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: How anxious did you feel (at the highest level of anxiety) as you completed the imagery task?  0 = Absolutely no anxiety. 10 = Totally anxious.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: How vividly did you imagine the situation?

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: How likely is it that the situation or task will turn out well versus turn out badly?

Items: Very likely to turn out well
Somewhat likely to turn out well
Somewhat likely to turn out badly
Very likely to turn out badly

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: If this situation did turn out badly, how well or badly would you be able to handle it?

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: On the next screen, you will be asked to write about a possible upcoming event in your life, or something that you are worried might happen. Before pressing NEXT, please think about a situation that might happen over the next week when you will feel anxious, scared, or worried. This can be a situation that makes you anxious a lot, or something that doesn't happen a lot. As you think of an event, try to really see yourself in the situation. Where are you? What day of the week is it? What time is it? Who is around you? What are you doing? How do you feel? After you come up with your situation, please press NEXT. Examples could include taking a test, talking to strangers, using social media, dealing with family or friends, or whatever makes you feel anxious.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: Please take a moment to write one or two sentences to describe the situation. Press next when you are ready to continue.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: For the next 30 seconds, please picture yourself in this situation. When you are finished, the screen will change automatically.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: Now, take the next 90 seconds to think of as many different thoughts that you could have in the situation as you can. These thoughts can be negative or positive. Be as creative as possible with all of the different thoughts you could have while you're in the situation that makes you anxious, especially thoughts that would help you feel less anxious.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: Great job! You predicted the future! Now, if your situation happens over the next week, you can have a lot of different thoughts come into your mind. Try to remember some of your thoughts that make you feel less anxious!

BeforeDomain.Name: Wrapping Up
BeforeDomain.Title: Wrapping Up
Description: Great job practicing flexible thinking today. Remember, try to use your new flexible thinking skills before your next training session!

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: Please imagine the situation as vividly as possible (i.e., so that it feels very real). Try to imagine you are actually in the situation. Play out the specific parts of the situation in your head. Try to imagine using all your senses while you think about this situation. Think about the things you would see, hear, and smell if you were really in that situation. Think about the kinds of things you would think or feel if you were actually there.

BeforeDomain.Name: Using Your Imagination
BeforeDomain.Title: Using Your Imagination
Description: Play this situation in your head for the next 20 seconds.

AfterDomain.Name: Predict the Future
AfterDomain.Title: Predict the Future
Description:
On the next screen, you will be asked to write about a possible upcoming event in your life, or something that you are worried might happen. Before pressing NEXT, please think about a situation that might happen over the next week when you will feel anxious, scared, or worried. This can be a situation that makes you anxious a lot, or something that doesn't happen a lot. 
 
As you think of an event, try to really see yourself in the situation. Where are you? What day of the week is it? What time is it? Who is around you? What are you doing? How do you feel? 
 
After you come up with your situation, please press NEXT. 
 
Examples could include taking a test, talking to strangers, using social media, dealing with family or friends, or whatever makes you feel anxious.

AfterDomain.Name: Predict the Future
AfterDomain.Title: Predict the Future
Description:
Please take a moment to write one or two sentences to describe the situation.
 
Press next when you are ready to continue.

AfterDomain.Name: Predict the Future
AfterDomain.Title: Predict the Future
Description: For the next 30 seconds, please picture yourself in the situation you just described. When you are finished, the screen will change automatically.

AfterDomain.Name: Predict the Future
AfterDomain.Title: Predict the Future
Description: Now, take the next 90 seconds to think of as many different thoughts that you could have in the situation as you can. These thoughts can be negative or positive. Be as creative as possible with all of the different thoughts you could have while you're in the situation that makes you anxious, especially thoughts that would help you feel less anxious.

AfterDomain.Name: Predict the Future
AfterDomain.Title: Predict the Future
Description: Great job! You predicted the future! Now, if your situation happens over the next week, you can have a lot of different thoughts come into your mind. Try to remember some of your thoughts that make you feel less anxious!

AfterDomain.Name: Wrapping Up
AfterDomain.Title: Wrapping Up
Description: Great job practicing flexible thinking today. Remember, try to use your new flexible thinking skills before your next training session!
